google_play_reviews.content: Can't save the file locally. You must upload it somewhere

While I appreciate that you don't require special permissions, this app's description isn't accurate. It only opens 1 picture at a time, and it will not process it: instead, it wants to use another app that you select, to post it online. That's not what we want. We want to strip our photos of metadata/exif data. Whether we post them immediately or not should not matter.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hey, thanks for your feedback. I am glad that you enjoy it. Hopefully I will be able to improve the functionality next year.

google_play_reviews.content: Simple and does the job. It asked no creepy permissions. Thanks. Please add option to select multiple photos.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Thanks for your feedback! 
We are glad that you find the app useful. 

I added batch processing of multiple photos to our to-do. 

Some users requested to save the "clean" images directly on the device which would require the storage access permission but we will only ask for it if the user wants to.
Hey Jin, thank you so much for your kind words.

google_play_reviews.content: This app is really helpful when you plan to share pictures as it automatically removes some metadata. It would be nice to save the edited files locally too and a support of LibreOffice documents would be amazing! By the way, the source is on GitHub and the app has no ads. üòç
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Jane, thanks for your review. I am glad that you like the app and find it useful. Your mentioned enhancements are already on our list and we hope to publish a new version later this year.

google_play_reviews.content: This app is very helpful for removing metadata from pictures. I am really looking forward to the support of Microsoft Office/LibreOffice metadata removal and the option to save the "clean" files on my microSD.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Franco, thanks for your review. I am glad that you like the app and find it useful. Your mentioned enhancements are already on our list and we hope to publish a new version later this year.

google_play_reviews.content: Two issues: 1) why doesn't it allow to save the result in /sdcard (user data)? Right now I have to upload to Google drive and then download to my device: that's extremely tedious. 2) It does not remove the EXIF data completely - looks like you're wiping it partially. E.g. JpegIFOffset and JpegBytecount tags remain.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Thanks for your feedback. üëç
We plan to enable saving the new file on the phone/microSD but it will take some time.
Could you please send two or three sample pictures (before and after metadata removal) to my email or post them on GitHub?

google_play_reviews.content: How to save the new file with metadata removed?
Doesnt work for videos / it took too long to process
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hey, thanks for your feedback. I am glad that you enjoy it. Hopefully I will be able to support videos next year.

google_play_reviews.content: instead of removing the metadata, it opens the share popup. and that doesn't work either.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Please contact me by e-mail so that I may fix this.
Hey, thank you so much for your kind words! üëç

google_play_reviews.content: I'm not sure the app even works yet. I was trying it on video. But more important is that the app doesn't have ads and the developer goes by crazy marvin so 5* :p
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hey, thank you so much for your kind words. Indeed videos are not supported at the moment unfortunately. Only metadata from pictures gets removed. I hope to find the time to support videos and documents next year though.
Hi, thanks for your feedback. We noted your feature wish. We will try to implement it until the end of this year.

google_play_reviews.content: Doesn't let me save the file, only lets me share it after exif has been removed
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Valerie, that's right. We plan to make saving the image possible in a future release. The initial idea was to use as few permissions as possible. But the new permission system allows us to use the storage permission only when the user wants. Please be patient while we are working on an update.
